medicinemanagements

Class InventoryManagementControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • medicinemanagements.InventoryManagementControl

  • public class InventoryManagementControl
extends java.lang.Object
    The InventoryManagementControl class manages the inventory of medicines in the system. It provides functionality to add, remove, and update medicines, as well as display the current inventory.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InventoryManagementControl(InitialDataMedicine medicineData)
      Constructs an InventoryManagementControl with the specified medicine data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNewMedicine(java.util.Scanner scanner)
      Adds a new medicine to the inventory by prompting the user for details such as name, initial stock, and low stock level alert.
      void displayInventory()
      Displays the current medication inventory in a formatted table, showing the medicine name, stock quantity, and low stock alert.
      void removeMedicine(java.util.Scanner scanner)
      Removes a medicine from the inventory by prompting the user to select a medicine from the displayed list.
      void updateLowStockLevelAlert(java.util.Scanner scanner)
      Updates the low stock level alert for a selected medicine.
      void updateStockInitial(java.util.Scanner scanner)
      Updates the initial stock of a selected medicine.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Constructs an InventoryManagementControl with the specified medicine data.

        Displays the current medication inventory in a formatted table, showing the medicine name, stock quantity, and low stock alert.
